name: Bonus Stage - Toronto Games Week
description:
Centred around micro talks given by local community members which serve the dual purpose of being informative and a conversation starter. Bonus Stage is a long running monthly social that gives people a space to mingle and get to know new people. Are you a game developer? Voice actor? Streamer? Game dev adjacent? Come join us!

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: SUNCHASER - Toronto Games Week
description:
People take turns flying MS Flight Simulator where you chase the sun as it sets. They will have to make constant speed adjustments to keep the top edge of the sun just above the horizon. Everything is projected on the walls around you so you get to bask in a sunset that lasts hours instead of minutes. A Closing Sunsetter Gathering will be hosted by artist Sherwin Tjia between 4-6pm.

name: Portable Preservation - Toronto Games Week

location.name: Royal Ontario Museum, Earth Rangers Studio, Schad Gallery of Biodiversity, Level 2

description:
Join the Broken Games Collective for a nostalgic showcase of portable videogames! Snap a pic at the Game Boy Camera photobooth, try a rare Game Boy sewing machine, and explore hidden gems from gaming history. Best of all, it’s free as part of ROM's Third Tuesday Nights Free monthly program.

name: Community Environment Day at Woodbine Mall
description:
Join Councillor Crisanti (Ward 1) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).
